III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/4/23, a staff member attacked a youth by punching the youth
and slamming them to the ground. There were no resulting
marks.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint Source was interviewed via phone on March 7, 2024.
Complaint Source reported Youth A disclosed the allegation
concerns to her on March 6, 2024. She reported Youth A did not
state who the staff was but confirmed it was a male staff. Complaint
Source reported Youth A moved to the inpatient psychiatric hospital
on March 5, 2024, after being assessed at the emergency room
children’s hospital. She reported Youth A had no behavioral concerns
at this time and they are continuing to review his medications for
mental health stabilization. Complaint Source reported she has not
witnessed any marks or bruises on Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at psychiatric hospital on
March 8, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported on March 3, 2024, earlier in the day he went on an outing
with Staff 1 into the community and it went well. He reported when he
came back from the outing Youth B had thrown his water bottle, he
asked her to not do that, and Youth B swore at him. Youth A reported
Youth B had also “tore up his hoodie” and removed the string from
the hood. He reported this piece of clothing meant a lot to him and
caused him to become upset. Youth A reported the youth in the unit
all provoked him and they all charged at him. He reported Staff 3 was
the only staff member on the unit at the time and when he asked for
support from Staff 3, he ignored him. Youth A reported all the youth
on the unit were saying they feared him, so Supervisor brought them
into the game room to get away from him. He reported a few
moments later, Staff 1 came back from another outing and came
onto the unit with him. Youth A reported that Staff 1 asked him, “You
2

hit them” referencing Youth B and Youth C and this caused Youth A
to become more upset. He reported Staff 1 told Youth A he is a
Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) fighter. Youth A reported Staff 2 was also
present in the unit and he was trying to help him de-escalate verbally
from the situation. He reported Staff 2 was just trying to do his job but
did not believe Staff 1 was. Youth A reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 kept
stating that they wanted to get the youth back into their bedrooms for
bed, but Youth A refused to move from standing in the doorway. He
reported Staff 1 told him, “You think I am a fussy, I will f you up.”
Youth A reported he closed his fist with his hand and got into a
fighting posture. Staff 2 tried to remind Youth A that this situation
would not help him. Youth A reported he walked around; Staff 1 had
his hands up in an MMA stance and told Youth A to back up and
Youth A asked to be left alone. He reported they continued to argue.
Staff 1 swung at him, and Youth A blocked the swing and kicked
Staff 1. Youth A reported Staff 1 grabbed his leg and slammed him
down to the ground. He reported his head hit the ground and he
blacked out. Youth A reported he remembered Staff 1 and Staff 2
had him in a restraint on the ground and Supervisor was holding his
legs. He reported Staff 1 was on top of him and Youth A tried to
choke him, but Staff 1 put his hand around his arm. Youth A reported
his wrist was bent within the restraint. He reported he does not
believe Staff 2 was trying to hurt him but believed Staff 1 was. Youth
A reported he did not have any injuries from this fight and reported
he denied seeing a nurse after the restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 8,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported on
03/03/2024 he took a different youth on an outing and when he
returned at 5pm he was told Youth A had assaulted the other youth
on the pod. Staff 1 reported he felt “upset and horrified” hearing
about the assault and took a few moments before going to assist with
Youth A. He reported Youth A had issues a couple of weeks ago as
he kicked Youth B and Youth A has been ruminating on the issues.
Staff 1 reported he attempted to process with Youth A, but Youth A
insisted he had the right to hurt people. He reported Staff 2 was also
present and assisting with processing with Youth A. Staff 1 reported
the processing session lasted about 2 hours and Youth A continued
to state he needed to go to the hospital for a mental health
assessment. He reported they tried to negotiate with Youth A to get
the other youth out of the game room to go to their room for bedtime.
Youth A reported that he would not do anything to the other youth
unless they did something to him. Staff were able to get two of the
youth back into their rooms but when it came time to get Youth B into
her room, Youth A refused to move from Youth B’s bedroom door.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was asked several times to move away from
the door and he told Youth A, “I am not going to let you hurt these
kids.” He reported Youth A became agitated and Youth A stated, “I
3

could push through staff.” Staff 1 reported Youth A began to circle
around him and come close to the staff. He reported he used “safe
hands” meaning that he stuck his hand out and asked for space from
Youth A. Staff 1 reported he never touched Youth A, but Youth A
would knock Staff 1’s hands down by slapping them. This process
was repeated a couple of times until Youth A pushed into Staff 1’s
fingers and lashed out at him. Youth A hit Staff 1 in the head near the
ear with his fist. Due to that hit, Staff 1 moved into a restraint hold but
they both lost their balance. They fell forward to the ground and Staff
1 landed on Youth A’s legs. Youth A had fallen into Staff 2 and
landed on his backside. Staff 1 straddled Youth A’s left leg with Staff
1’s knees on the floor while holding Youth A’s arm. Staff 1 had two
hands around Youth A’s writs and forearm while Staff 2 had Youth
A’s other arm. This was an approved two-person floor hold from
QBS. Youth A continued to yell and stated that he was going to kill
them. Staff 1 reported someone called a Code Green and additional
staff came to assist. He reported when the additional staff arrived
himself and Staff 2 disengaged with Youth A. Staff 1 denied
swearing at Youth A during the situation and denied punching him.
He denied ever standing in a fighting stance or slamming Youth A to
the ground. He reported the only reason they ended up on one
ground was because of a loss of balance.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 8,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported he
was called over to help with Youth A from Supervisor on 3/3/2024.
He reported when he arrived at the unit, Youth A was yelling and
walking around. Staff 2 reported he was able to process with Youth A
while the other youths were in the game room. Staff 1 came into the
unit around 6:30pm and they continued to process with Youth A.
Staff 2 reported it was time to bring the youth back to the unit
because they needed to get ready for bed. Staff 2 reported his role
was to help walk the youth into their room, while Staff 1 continued to
talk with Youth A. He reported he got two youths into their rooms and
when it was time for Youth B to go to her room, Youth A refused to
get away from Youth B’s door. Staff 2 reported Youth A was given
the direction he needed to move from the room. He reported Staff 1
continued to talk with Youth A and told him Youth A’s intimidation
was not going to work on them. Youth A continued to be
disrespectful, frustrated, and walked towards them with his fists
balled up. Staff 2 reported he was near Staff 1 and Youth A was in
front of Staff 1. Youth A made the statement to the staff that they
were going to have to move him, and Youth A walked closer to the
staff. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 continued to tell Youth A to give him
space and placed his hands up, not touching Youth A, to signal to
give him space. Youth A then pushed Staff 1 and he swung at Staff
1. Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempted to get Youth A into a two-person
restraint, but Youth A continued to swing at Staff 1 and grabbed Staff
4

1’s neck. Then due to the motion, they fell to the ground. Youth A fell
backwards into Staff 2 causing Staff 2 to fall and hit his head on the
wall. Youth A continued to attempt to hit and choke Staff 1 while they
were on the ground. Staff 2 reported he was able to grab Youth A’s
right arm and Staff 2 had his left arm. He reported Supervisor called
for a Code Green and she got on Youth A’s legs for the floor hold.
Staff 2 reported when the additional staff arrived, he was able to
disengage from the restraint. He denied seeing Staff 1 swing or
punch Youth A at any time. Staff 2 reported no one slammed Youth A
to the ground and Staff 1 never went into a fighting stance. He
reported Staff 1 used safe hands which is within the QBS training
guide as a Protective Shuffle. Staff 2 reported he never heard Staff 1
swear at Youth A. He reported the restraint they completed is what
they are trained to do.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
12, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor
reported on 03/03/24, that she was wrapping up her shift around 4pm
but was alerted that a youth on the Ruby unit wanted to talk to her.
She reported when she got to the unit, she saw Youth A was kicking
Youth C and Youth B was bleeding from her nose. Supervisor
reported Staff 3 was on the unit with four kids while Staff 4 was
outside with another youth, which was within ratio. Supervisor
reported she immediately went to call a code status and saw Staff 1
walking towards them. She reported she did not have time to process
what was going on but needed to get the youth into safe spaces.
Supervisor reported they got the youth into the game room and Staff
2 came over to help with the de-escalation of Youth A. She reported
she never got a call on the walkie-talkie from Staff 1 but was told to
come over to talk to the youth. Supervisor reported Youth B had
processed Youth A was upset over a hoodie and Staff 3 did not do
anything to stop it. She reported Staff 1 came over to help with the
de-escalation of Youth A when he got back from an outing.
Supervisor reported after several hours of talking, Staff 2 began to
escort the youths back to their rooms for bedtime. She reported two
youths got back to their rooms and when it came to Youth B's time to
go, Youth A refused to move from the door. Supervisor reported she
went onto the unit to make sure room checks were done with the two
youths in their rooms already. She stated Staff 4 was back with
Youth B and Youth C in the game room. Supervisor reported she
kept an eye on the situation as Youth A continued to refuse
redirection. She stated Staff 1 was in front of Youth A and Staff 2 was
to the side. Supervisor stated Youth A was swearing and Staff 1 put
his hands up to give space. She stated Youth A kept hitting Staff 1’s
hands and then lunged at Staff 1. She reported once she saw the
lunge, she called a Code Green and went into the room for the
restraint. Supervisor reported Youth A was face up on the ground
Staff 1 and Staff 2 had each arm and she was on his legs. She
5

reported it was an approved two-person hold on the ground that is
trained in QBS. Supervisor reported once the Code Green support
came in, herself, Staff 1 and Staff 2 disengaged restraint. The extra
support staff came in and completed a second restraint with Youth A.
She stated at the end, Youth A did not want to see nursing and she
saw no marks or bruises. Supervisor reported she has no concerns
with Staff 1 or Staff 2’s ability to do their job appropriately. She stated
she never saw any staff hit or punch Youth A or slam Youth A to the
ground. Supervisor reported she does not know how they got to the
ground as during that time she was calling a Code Green.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 12,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported
Youth A had punched her in the face last week when he was upset
about his sweatshirt. She reported Youth A had also kicked Youth C
on the ground. Youth B reported when this was occurring it was only
Staff 3 on the unit because Staff 4 was outside with another youth.
She stated Supervisor came over to the unit and got them into a safe
room away from Youth A. Youth B reported she felt Staff 3 did not
react fast enough in the situation. She reported she feels safe in the
unit when Youth A is not there. Youth B became emotional over the
interview and left the room.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 12,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported the
other weekend Youth A had kicked him and punched Youth A in the
face. He reported Youth A was upset because he gave Youth B his
jacket and something happened. Youth C reported it was quick
escalation and Staff 3 did everything he could to keep them safe. He
reported Staff 3 was the one to get Youth A to stop kicking him.
Youth C reported Supervisor came over and got the youth in the
game room away from Youth A while a bunch of other people
responded to the Code Green. He reported he feels safe on the unit
when Youth A is not there.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 13,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he
was working with Staff 4 on 03/03/2024. He reported it was courtyard
time and the unit he was working on had five youths in total. Staff 3
reported only one youth wanted to outside in the courtyard, so Staff 4
took them out. He reported Youth A’s mood had been up and down
for several weeks and continued to get into verbal arguments with
Youth B and Youth C. Staff 3 reported Youth A was upset about an
article of clothing that was on the table when asked about it. He
stated Youth A never got the article of clothing but started to become
verbally heightened with the other youth. Staff 3 stated this is not
abnormal behavior, and this typically lasts several hours long. He
stated he continued to verbally redirect the conversation and stated,
6

“Let’s all get along”. Staff 3 reported he offered activity options such
as doing arts and crafts, going outside, etc. He reported Youth A
continued to be fixated on Youth B having the drawstring to his article
of clothing. Staff 3 reported within a split-second Youth A got up in
Youth B’s face and punched her and then went over to Youth C and
knocked him on the ground and kicked him. He stated Youth A then
pushed Youth D. Staff 3 reported this whole situation lasted less than
sixty seconds and he called for help over the walkie-talkie. He stated
he went to check on each of the youths while continuing to verbally
de-escalate Youth A. Staff 3 reported when he went over to call for a
Code Green, Supervisor had arrived, and she had called the code.
He stated Supervisor arrived less than two minutes before the
situation occurred. Staff 3 reported he assisted with getting the three
youths into the game room and Staff 2 came over to de-escalate
Youth A. Staff 3 reported he did not witness any of the restraint. He
reported he helped care for the youth who needed attention. Staff 3
reported it all happened super-fast and bickering is not an abnormal
occurrence with Youth A and Youth B so he did not think it was going
to become physical.
Documents Reviewed:
- Lotus Program- Restraint Policy dated 06/2023- This policy
notes “Physical punishment, such as hitting or striking,
kicking, pulling, or pushing a resident on any part of a
resident’s boys; verbal abuse including the use of derogatory
or discriminatory language, yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation; and peer-on-peer discipline are strictly prohibited.”
The staff are trained to use the QBS model for de-escalation
and restraint procedures. Staff are trained on this policy
during orientation and restraint training.
- Code Green/Emergency Assistance Policy dated 06/2023-
This policy notes that staff will determine the necessity of
initiating a Code Green/ Emergency Assistance call. A Code
Green is a signal to other Pine Rest Staff that additional
assistance is needed in the area.
- Lotus Incident Report dated 03/03/2024 completed by
Staff 1- This incident report was consistent with Staff 1’s
interview of details of the events that occurred.
- MiSACWIS Report # 176200219- This report is consistent
with Lotus Incident Report dated 03/03/2024 and Staff 1’s
interview.
- QBS restraint model guide- Staff 1 spoke about “safe
hands” which follows the QBS stance of a protective shuffle,
which should be used to provide space. Staff 1 and Staff 2
were described to be doing a two-person supine hold that is
approved by the model. This hold includes having two staff
7

having place the youth’s arms outward from the body on the
ground with kneeling alongside the body. If there is a need a
third person can come to hold the youth’s legs. Youth A’s
body was facing up, Staff 1 was holding one arm, and Staff 2
was holding the other arm and Supervisor was holding Youth
A's legs. The way the restraint was described via interviews
from Staff 1, Staff 2, and Supervisor, the hold was an
approved hold per the QBS model.
- Nursing Note dated 03/04/2024 completed by Nurse 1-
Youth A met with Nurse 1 on 03/04/2024. Youth A had no
physical concerns but noted that he wanted to assault staff
members at the facility.
- Nursing Note dated 03/03/2024 completed by Nurse 2-
Nurse 2 responded to the Code Green call on 03/03/2024.
Upon arrival, Youth B had a bloody nose and medical
attention was given. The nosebleed stopped after a few
moments. Youth C reported to Nurse 2 he was pushed to the
ground and kicked several times in the abdomen and back. It
was observed Youth C had bruising on his left flan and was
given ice. Youth C refused pain medication and was checked
in on after 45 minutes late and reported no concerns.
- Staff 1 Human Resource File- There has no disciplinary
actions noted within Staff 1’s Human Resource File. Staff 1 is
up to date on all his trainings. His most recent training on the
restraint model was completed on 10/04/2023.
- Staff 2 Human Resource File- There has no disciplinary
actions noted within Staff 2’s Human Resource File. Staff 2 is
up to date on all his trainings. His most recent training on the
restraint model was completed on 10/29/2023.
- Staff 3 Human Resource File- There has no disciplinary
actions noted within Staff 3’s Human Resource File. Staff 3 is
up to date on all his trainings. His most recent training on the
restraint model was completed on 01/11/2024.
- Police Report from Kent County Sheriff’s dated
03/06/2024- Police met with Youth A to interview in private
about the reported concern of the assault. Youth A reported
Staff 1 had punched him in the head and threw him on the
ground. Police saw no visible injuries on Youth A. Police
interviewed Supervisor, Staff 1, and Staff 2. All those
interviews were consistent with the interviews conducted in
this report.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Staff 1, Staff 2, and
Supervisor all denied Staff 1 punched or slammed youth to the
ground.
8

Consultation:
Consultation was offered for the agency to review if there is a
need for additional staffing on the unit, especially when it is known
a youth has been having escalated physical aggression towards
another youth on the same unit.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
